mdContact.rpOrgName: Australian Government Department of Sustainability, Environment, Water, Population and Communities

dataLineage.statement:
The data is a double precision coverage generated in ArcInfo from the schedules (legal descriptions) of MPA's. The projection is geographics and the datum is GDA94 (which for practical purposes is synonymous with WGS84). Tolerances used were less then or equal to 0.00000001DD (approximately 1mm). The legal descriptions use parallels, meridians and geodesics between specified geographic coordinates, boundaries from the Australian Maritime Boundaries (AMB) dataset (eg coastal water limit, eez limit), and isobaths.
The lines were created/sourced from: - parallels and meridians were generated in ArcInfo using coordinates specified in legal descriptions. Generated lines were densified to 0.05 decimal degrees (approx. 5km) prior to incorporation with other linework. - intermediate points along geodesic lines were generated using the MarBound Software developed by Melbourne University prior to generating the lines in ArcInfo. A maximum segment length of 5km was used, which for this data ensures geodesic lines are within 1 metre of their true position. - maritime boundaries were source from AMB 2006 v2.0. - the 50m isobath sourced from NSW NPWS Solitary Islands MPA data. This was checked against the Seafarer Nautical Charts for accuracy and appears to be reasonably accurate (see positional accuracy).
For each MPA, appropriate linework was generated/selected and then intersected to form polygons.
Zone boundaries for relevant MPA's were generated from descriptions in gazettal notices, management plans and prohibition notices.

srcCitatn.resTitle: Australian Government Department of Sustainability, Environment, Water, Population and Communities (DSEWPaC).
Geoscience Australia, Australian Government Department of Resources, Energy and Tourism (DRET).

ConResult.conExpl:
Variable (from 1mm to 500m).
All boundaries are based on legal descriptions, which include specific coordinates as well as references to AMB boundaries. Solitary Island Marine Reserve also includes reference to the 50m isobath.
- Coordinates (vertices) have been created extremely accurately (within 1mm). - Parallels/meridians have been created extremely accurately (within 1mm). - Geodesics have been calculated to within 1 metre using the MarBound software from Melbourne University - Lines from AMB v2.0 have been mapped to an accuracy generally better than 150 metres standard deviation. - The positional accuracy of the 50m isobath used in the Solitary Island Marine Reserve is unknown, but is likely to be less than 500m.
Attributes are based on the documented Collaborative Australian Protected Areas Database (CAPAD) specifications.
The data provides a complete set of boundaries for MPAs gazetted to December 2010.
